html:
Wash. The term may refer to washing with water the hands and feet of individuals about to enter the temple. It also points to baptism (see also the corrected reading herein of 48:1), which is a ritual cleansing from sins and transgressions. Ultimately, washing with water represents symbolic washing with the blood of Christ to become spiritually clean.

eyes. Eyes "are a representation of light and knowledge" (D&C 77:4; 88:67). "God, of course, has all knowledge and is full of light. Thus it is said of him that his eye is an 'all-searching eye' (2 Ne. 9:44) and a 'piercing eye' (Jacob 2:10), meaning there is no place that his eye cannot penetrate and nothing that he does not know. He is omniscient." Thus in 1:16, God is aware of the Israelites' evil doings, and he commands them to cease.
